message.content:
cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.NA, cs.RO 

The paper deals with approximation algorithms for two classic optimization problems in computer science, namely k-medians and facility location. These problems are typically studied in the subfields of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS), discrete mathematics (cs.DM), game theory (cs.GT), numerical analysis (cs.NA), and robotics (cs.RO). The paper's focus on approximation algorithms and performance guarantees suggests that it is more likely to be classified under cs.DS or cs.DM, but the use of probabilistic bounds and randomized rounding may also make it relevant to cs.NA and cs.GT. The subfield of robotics (cs.RO) is less likely, but not entirely implausible, as facility location problems have applications in robotics and sensor networks.
